intro: Lourea convallaria, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. Lourea convallaria is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in humid conditions.
